Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE CHILD CENTER OF NEW YORK INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO NURTURE THE EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING OF CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES BY PROVIDING COUNSELING FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES, PREVENTING ABUSE AND NEGLECT, AND PROVIDING CHILD AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT IN CHILD CARE, AFTER SCHOOL, AND OTHER COMMUNITY SETTINGS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: IN FISCAL YEAR 2010, THE CHILD CENTER SERVED 17,000 CHILDREN AT RISK DUE TO POVERTY, RECENT IMMIGRATION OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES. THE ORGANIZATION'S GOAL IS TO INSURE THAT CHILDREN GROW UP TO FEEL SECURE AND SELF CONFIDENT, BE SUCCESSFUL IN SCHOOL (AND LATER WORK) AND HAVE EMPATHY FOR OTHERS.
IRS990.Description: TREATMENT FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES, INCLUDING MEDICATION EDUCATION AND PRESCRIPTION; AND HOME VISITING TO PREVENT PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITALIZATION FOR SERIOUSLY EMOTIONALLY DISTURBED TEENS AND YOUTH, INCLUDING 24/7 CRISIS INTERVENTION, CASE MANAGEMENT AND PARENT EDUCATION.

Activity2.Description: FAMILY INTERVENTION PROTECTS CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS FROM ABUSE AND NEGLECT THAT ARISES FROM SEVERELY DYSFUNCTIONAL AND DESTRUCTIVE HOME ENVIRONMENTS.

Activity3.Description: BOTH CENTER AND HOME-BASED EARLY CHILDHOOD SERVICES ARE GEARED TO INSURE THAT CHILDREN ARE DEVELOPMENTALLY ON TRACK AND PREPARED FOR KINDERGARTEN AND TO PROVIDE PARENT EDUCATION AND OTHER SUPPORT TO FAMILIES. THIS INCLUDES PROGRAMS OPERATED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE NEW YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SUCH AS YOUNG ADULT BOROUGH CENTER, ASPIRATIONS DIPLOMA PLUS HIGH SCHOOL AND TUTORING PROVIDED THROUGH NO CHILD LEFT BEHIND.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL SALARIED STAFF RECEIVE AN ANNUAL COST OF LIVING ADJUSTMENT. THE BOARD REVIEWS COMPENSATION OF THE CEO, OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES PERIODICALLY IN COMPARISON TO THE INDUSTRY AND MAY MAKE ADJUSTMENTS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE POLICY IS CIRCULATED TO ALL NEW EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS AND IS CIRCULATED ANNUALLY TO EXISTING EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS. THE COMPLETION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REPORTING FORM IS REQUIRED AT LEAST ANNUALLY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS CIRCULATED TO ALL CURRENT BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO ITS BEING FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: BOTH CENTER AND HOME-BASED EARLY CHILDHOOD SERVICES ARE GEARED TO INSURE THAT CHILDREN ARE DEVELOPMENTALLY ON TRACK AND PREPARED FOR KINDERGARTEN AND TO PROVIDE PARENT EDUCATION AND OTHER SUPPORT TO FAMILIES. THIS INCLUDES PROGRAMS OPERATED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE NEW YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SUCH AS YOUNG ADULT BOROUGH CENTER, ASPIRATIONS DIPLOMA PLUS HIGH SCHOOL AND TUTORING PROVIDED THROUGH NO CHILD LEFT BEHIND.
